description: DRL is the premier global league for professional first-person-view (FPV) drone racing . Pilots fly custom, identical drones at speeds up to 90 mph (with RacerX model reaching record 163.5 mph) through intricate indoor and outdoor 3D courses. A hybrid of sports, media, and tech, DRL airs globally across NBC, Sky Sports, Fox Sports Asia, and streaming platforms like Twitter. They also operate DRL SIM, a virtual training simulator, and launched the autonomous racing series AIRR. DRL boasts ~75 million fans, reaching 250 million households in 140+ countries . It emphasizes innovation via partnerships (e.g., 5G streaming drones) and educational outreach through DRL Academy and the “Science of Drone Racing” curriculum

projects.name: Fleet Management System
projects.description: A system used to manage the fleet of drones, including tracking their status, telemetry, location, and performance metrics.

projects.name: Event Management System
projects.description: A system that manages the scheduling, logistics, and operations of drone racing events.

projects.name: Timing & Scoring
projects.description: A application that aggregates data from multiple sources to provide real-time timing and scoring for DRL Pilots during racing events.

achievements: Automated scoring logic in the Timing & Scoring platform, reducing race downtime by 6.67% and streamlining pilot ranking calculations.
Refactored the Fleet Management System, improving stability and decoupling components to accelerate future feature development.
Championed agile practices and introduced unit testing, boosting delivery velocity and increasing overall code reliability.
